props.synopsis: Prime Minister Anthony Albanese has returned to Canberra as the Liberals begin the search for a new leader after Peter Dutton's defeat in his seat of Dickson. Follow live.

title.children: PM returns to Canberra as process to pick new frontbench begins

image.altText: A young couple

props.synopsis: From the outer suburbs to the seaside, the Coalition was abandoned by its core base. The ABC spoke to voters in key changing seats to ask why.

title.children: 'Laughable policies': Voters explain what went wrong for Coalition

image.altText: man with a bald head and glasses faces a man with blond hair

props.synopsis: Australians saw through the Coalition's attempt to have it both ways and dealt with Peter Dutton as if he was Donald Trump.

title.children: First Canada, then Australia: Trump is toxic for conservatives everywhere

image.altText: Hollie Hughes dstop

props.synopsis: One of the contenders to be Liberal leader, Shadow Treasurer Angus Taylor, has been blasted by Liberal senator Hollie Hughes, who claims his lack of policy work was to blame for the party's election rout.

title.children: Liberal MP slams leadership contender Angus Taylor

image.altText: Anthony Albanese holds up his hands to calm the crowd.

props.synopsis: Last year Anthony Albanese was staring down the barrel of an historic election loss. That feeling must drive the next phase of government action.

title.children: The message to the Coalition is clear: This is not John Howard's Australia

image.altText: Election corflutes featuring Peter Dutton on display.

props.synopsis: The voters of Dickson made history when they cast their ballots in 2025, causing Peter Dutton to become the first federal opposition leader to lose their seat.

title.children: Dutton's successor labels work-from-home stance 'crazy' as voters weigh in

image.altText: Dutton, on stage, reaches his hand high to wave

props.synopsis: The election result is a tale of two cities — Labor has picked up healthy swings on first preferences in affluent areas but there are signs of discontent in the outer suburbs.

title.children: Liberals on brink of near-total wipe-out in Australia's suburbs

image.altText: A man stares intently at the camera, his expression is neutral. He is wearing a puffer jacket and standing outdoors.

props.synopsis: The man accused of orchestrating a series of antisemitic attacks in Sydney, has spoken exclusively to Four Corners from his overseas hideout.

title.children: 'Mastermind' of caravan terror plot is on the run, and speaking to Four Corners

image.altText: A digital drawing of Erin Patterson wearing a pink shirt

props.synopsis: The murder trial of Erin Patterson continues in the Latrobe Valley Law Courts in Morwell. She's charged with killing three relatives by serving them a meal laced with poisonous mushrooms. Follow the trial in our live blog.

title.children: Simon Patterson testimony continues in Erin Patterson's murder trial

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: Erin's lack of curiosity about Don and Gail Patterson examined by defence
WATCH: Recap of the first week of the mushroom murder trial

image.altText: A render of the proposed Macquarie Point stadium, showing a wood-panelled round structure

props.synopsis: The Tasmanian government plans to fund construction of the stadium via borrowings, rather than looking to partner with the private sector, saying the latter would carry too high a risk to the state and threaten already tight timelines.

title.children: Tasmanian government to go it alone on AFL stadium funding

image.altText: Oscar Piastri brandishes Miami GP trophy in orange racing kit

props.synopsis: Australian Oscar Piastri produces another brilliant drive to claim the Formula 1 Miami Grand Prix, his fourth win of the season.

title.children: Flawless Piastri beats teammate Norris to win Miami Grand Prix

image.altText: A stock trader looks down at a tablet as he works on the floor of a busy stock exchange while surrounded by screens.

props.synopsis: Better-than-expected jobs figures and easing trade tensions have driven Wall Street higher. However, the ASX has opened lower on a disappointing Westpac result and falling oil prices. Follow the day's events and insights from our business reporters on the ABC News live markets blog.

title.children: Wall St rebound rolls on as trade tensions ease, ASX slips on Westpac's $3.5b interim profit

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: ASX down 0.5%, hit by bank and energy sell-off
Gold Road Resources to be taken over in  $3.7b deal

image.altText: kayak at Samsonvale 2020

props.synopsis: A 55-year-old man has been charged with murder and fraud over a woman's death, initially considered an accidental drowning, in Joyner, north of Brisbane, five years ago.

title.children: Murder charge laid over death of woman initially thought to have accidentally drowned

image.altText: Donald Trump purses his lips as he stands in front of a US flag

props.synopsis: In a wideranging interview covering his plans for Canada, the economy and a possible third term, US President Donald Trump says he does not know whether Americans have a right to due process as laid out in the country's constitution.

title.children: Trump raises doubt over Americans' right to due process

image.altText: Labor's Zhi Soon with prime minister anthony albanese who is holding a dog. They are both at a polling booth

props.synopsis: The number of Sydney seats held by the Liberal Party has halved, as Labor captured the southern Liberal suburban seats of Hughes and Banks, and held onto Werriwa in the south-west.

title.children: Why the Liberal Party's outer-suburban seat strategy 'comprehensively failed'

image.altText: MP Dan Tehan smiles as he holds a flyer. There are people in the background.

props.synopsis: It was predicted Liberal MP Dan Tehan might lose his south-west Victorian seat. Now his name is in the mix to lead the party.

title.children: Once tipped to lose his seat, Dan Tehan now touted as possible Liberal leader

image.altText: Jacinta Allan and Anthony Albanese at National Cabinet press conference

props.synopsis: Labor's landslide win in the federal election may not mean Victoria's Premier Jacinta Allan is completely off the hook with voters, but it will ease some pressure — for now.

title.children: Jacinta Allan no longer Labor's 'problem child' as Liberal woes deepen

image.altText: scene from remote Cape York community

props.synopsis: One of Queensland’s most remote communities is without its only supermarket, service station and campground, with workers allegedly owed pay. But locals are in the dark about what has gone on.

title.children: Probe launched as town's only supermarket and service station close

image.altText: A brick church with a sign saying 'All are welcome in this place'.

props.synopsis: Churches in Canberra and Newcastle are expelled from their denominational association after refusing to support a conservative stance on same-sex marriage.

title.children: Canberra Baptist Church expelled from association over same-sex marriage support

image.altText: Israel Yemen Mideast Wars

props.synopsis: A missile fired by Yemen's Houthi rebels slips through Israel's air defence systems, hitting near the country's main airport and leaving some people in the vicinity "lightly wounded".

title.children: Israel closes main airport after Houthi missile hits nearby

image.altText: chocolate aisle

props.synopsis: Food company leaders are trying to find the sweet spot between soaring cocoa and coffee prices and economically anxious consumers.

title.children: Cocoa prices soar but the world's biggest chocolate makers bet we'll keep buying

image.altText: Lady Gaga appears on a large screen above a crowd at her concert

props.synopsis: Brazilian police say a free concert on Rio's Copacabana Beach that drew millions of fans was the target of a bomb plot.

title.children: Brazilian police arrest two people over alleged Lady Gaga bomb plot

image.altText: A man in a hat and red check shirt sits with a woman with black hair

props.synopsis: When Hywel Rowlands and Tra My Tran went looking for love online, scammers honed in. They want to help others know when they're at risk of losing their money as well as their hearts.

title.children: Romantic end to search for true love despite online scammers

image.altText: Christina Paulus sits in a crowded hospital hallway holding her newborn with other mothers sleeping nearby.

props.synopsis: One of PNG's most respected and longstanding doctors says thousands of women have been treated on the floor of the country's main hospital due to a lack of beds and maternity spaces, with capacity for the neglected hospital surpassed in the 1990s.

title.children: More than 7,000 women and newborns treated on hospital floor

image.altText: Close-up of Tasmania Devils AFL team foundation jumper design.

props.synopsis: Tasmania's AFL club has secured star recruiting pair Derek Hine and Todd Patterson as it continues preparations to enter the national league.

title.children: Tasmania Devils land gun pair in recruiting coup for fledgling AFL club

image.altText: Justin Longmuir looks to his right during a Dockers AFL match.

props.synopsis: This season was described as being the "best chance" the Fremantle Dockers had to be in contention in a decade, but as inconsistencies emerge, questions are being raised about coach Justin Longmuir's tenure.

title.children: The 'emotional masochism' facing Dockers fans after latest loss

image.altText: Grey-haired man in his 60's, wearing cap, smiling, arms on fence, dairy cows in background

props.synopsis: A fourth-generation dairy farmer is using a world-first genetic index to breed heat tolerant cattle, with his animals grazing in hot, sticky conditions and producing large quantities of commercial-grade milk.

title.children: Farmers breeding heat tolerant cows to better cope with changing climate

image.altText: Smaller vessels are seen around the Conscience

props.synopsis: The Freedom Flotilla Coalition says its ship was attacked by Israeli drones in the early hours of Friday morning and needs urgent repairs so it can continue its journey to break the Gaza aid blockade.

title.children: Pro-Palestinian activists negotiate with Malta about repairs to Gaza aid ship

image.altText: A man with a missing tooth gives a big smile wearing a beanie.

props.synopsis: Lynton Ryan, 31, died after being found unresponsive in his cell. His grieving family fear it will be years before they are told how he died.

title.children: Grieving mother pleads for answers on how son died in WA jail

image.altText: A mid shot of Zendaya in heavy makeup and a green and blue gown.

props.synopsis: The annual Met Gala in NYC is a dazzling collision of celebrity, fashion and media frenzy. Here's what to expect this year.

title.children: Theme, guest list and everything you need to know about the 2025 Met Gala

image.altText: Glen Oliver discovered a new variety of date palm ten years ago.

props.synopsis: Mitakoodi man Glen Oliver has nurtured a huge variety of plant species over the years, but the highlight of his career in horticulture has been discovering a new date palm.

title.children: Date variety discovered by outback horticulturalist now grown globally

image.altText: Barnaby Joyce sits in parliament.

props.synopsis: Barnaby Joyce says he will undergo surgery after being diagnosed with prostate cancer.

title.children: Nationals MP Barnaby Joyce reveals prostate cancer diagnosis

image.altText: Joseph-Aukuso Suaalii palms off Len Ikitau.

props.synopsis: Joseph-Aukuso Suaalii has been outstanding at fullback in the Super Rugby Pacific season, but it remains to be seen if he's done enough to force the talented Tom Wright out of the position for the Wallabies.

title.children: Suaalii adds more intrigue to Wallabies' selection quandary for Lions series

image.altText: Lang Lang plays a white grand piano in a silver suite next to a five-year-old girl, surrounded by a sea of performers in yellow

props.synopsis: Whether it's on the concert stage, our screens, or at world events like the Olympics, music for the piano is all around us.

title.children: Tracing the history of the piano through centuries of music

image.altText: Person standing in large open space holds coloured flag above their head.

props.synopsis: When artist Lauren Brincat began to speak with care workers in Sydney, amazing stories emerged. Months later, the conversations culminated in a huge public performance designed to connect carers and the community with each other.

title.children: This artist asked a nurse 'Who cares for you?' She was struck by the reply
